The main focus of the PI's research were quadratic algebras defined by Fomin and Kirillov and the theory of flow polytopes. In collaboration with G. Panova and A. Postnikov, the PI proved a special case of the Nonnegativity conjecture of Fomin and Kirillov, the first progress in this direction in over a decade.  In collaboration with J. Blasiak and R. I. Liu, the PI studied the generalized Fomin-Kirillov algebras and established some of their striking combinatorial features, such as their symmetric Hilbert series, when the algebras are finite-dimensional. The PI also studied flow polytopes, and their relation to Kostant partition functions appearing in representation theory. In particular, the PI constructed families of flow polytopes whose volumes are given by combinatorial product formulas, and studied the corresponding Kostant partition functions evaluating to these product formulas. In collaboration with A. H. Morales, the PI also introduced the dynamic Kostant partition function, which can be seen as a generalization of the Kostant partition function for signed graphs. The PI also pursued research projects in game theory, permutation statistics, and poset topology. The PI made a special effort to engage undergraduate and graduate students in her research and made all her papers freely available.
